ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This was an excellent course that furthered our understanding of vessels through its creative and open-minded approach.

In this class, I gained insight and knowledge beyond my expectations. Through the course, I learned and was encouraged to engage and learn from my fellow students across discplines--art history, music, art. My love and understanding of material culture and craft has grown, evolved, and developed by learning from a professor who clearly loves and is incredibly passionate and knowledgable on the subject matter.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The opportunity to experiment with making vessels from various materials was a strength of the course and provided students with unique insights about the subject of the course. The open-minded nature of the syllabus was also helpful visits to the Peabody Museum collections and West Campus made the class all the more engaging.

I can honestly say, for me, that this course only has strengths. I loved engaging and learning from my fellow classmates and thoroughly enjoyed Professor Cooke's valuable and thoughtful insight into the subject material.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to another student. The syllabus was well organized to offer students with a wide variety of perspectives on the subject of the course. The opportunities to experiment with making vessels, make use of the facilities at West Campus, and visit the Peabody collections made the class incredibly engaging.

Professor Cooke is one of the most thoughtful, caring, and engaging professors I have ever met. He values his students opinions and insights and is able to provide knowledgable feedback to them. The course provided students with a deeper understanding of the subject matter of vessels through off-site visits to studio spaces. Additionally, we went to Yale West Campus's Art Gallery to access art objects off-campus. These visits provided students with a much deeper understanding of the subject matter. This is one of the best courses I have ever taken to date. I truly believe anyone---art historian or not---would greatly benefit from taking this course.
